text:
I never could harm the penguins.
They even say "I love you" and follow you around in the level.
They are so cute!
author: Pr3dator

text: Isn't that the game with that asshole partner who takes all the credit of everything you've done?
author: Sir Seliph

text: Off to kill that polar bear tank that shits mines. No real point to getting it here but its fun anyway. Lets do it!

text: SSSV is FULL of fantastic music.
author: Young Immortal

text: More Silicon Valley music please SupraDarky!

text: That font selection makes me think Banjo Kazooie

text: Wii U VC release pls.

text:
After just hearing "Ennio Morricone - Le vent, le cri" I immediately thought of this game and this level. Anyone else hear that?
I did try googling but saw no mention of it :/
author: Allan C

text:
I never got to play this game but I'll probably get around to doing so soon.
I've heard nothing but good things about it.
author: Zela Less

text: holy shieeeet thought i was the only one who played this
author: PandaZMafia

text:
Wow, this track sounds oddly familiar for a game I never played.
Love it, now I have a reason to try it out.
author: Fak Yuh Googel

text: Ahh this game , takes me back to when life was simple . The soundtrack was amazing
author: INGSOC

text: great music track
author: Spybionic

text: Loved this game but MAN was it broken. Like literally every copy released has a bug making picking up a collectable necessary to full game completion impossible...Gotta wonder how a "little" thing like that got through beta testing lol.
author: KatOtter

text: Yeah I remember that, I just couldn't understand why was it not possible to pick up that gold water tap, I never witnessed game bugs before, it was quite sad. I think I even had all other gold pickups, played this game a lot.
author: weeeekt

text: +KatOtter there was a cheat to get the last trophy and finish the game =D
author: js100serch

text: Yeah. Usually when devs notice an error, they'll just rerelease newer, polished copies of the game. But, because this game didn't sell too well, that didn't happen.
author: Toasturhz toastbunz

text: This game. I've only ever played it once. It's hard.
author: Retrauk

text: Difficulty:extreme D:
author: Хосе Альберто

text:
The last level was a PITA rail shooter. 

Great game though, so good when I was a kid with a real imagination
author: Alex Williams

text: I rented this once or twice from Blockbuster and I remember a state or two that would piss me off when I was younger.  Other than that, was a fun game.
author: Rusa

text: This one of those games I always forget exists and wish that I didn't.  This track is new to me, but it fits in with what I remember of the soundtrack having strangely Wallace & Gromit-esque vibes.
author: Jonochrome

text: Very cool! Can't believe this is the first I've heard of this game.
author: BB5_MGAN

text: I remember having quite a lot of fun playing this game, though I never finished it. Running around as a mini robot and possessing various animals each with their abilities to solve puzzles was certainly entertaining. This game was made by the creators of the GTA series, which is interesting to note!
author: SupraDarky

text: Gabe, this game also came out for the Gameboy Color in Europe as well as the Play Station.  I'm not sure if you're going to include in the description, but I thought I would let you know about that.  Also that song was very playful sounding.
author: Eric C.

text: I really liked that game but I only rented it and never completed it. Didn't remember what the music sounds like.. pretty good!
author: Phenom Uprising

text:
@Eric C.
He didn't mention the GBC release since that's a different game with different music, where this track uploaded here does not play. He only mentions the platforms a certain track can be heard on. He could mention the PSX version, though.
author: Burkhart von Klitzing
